About Me

Software Engineering Graduate / Application Developer / Front-End Freelance Programmer

BIO

Graduated from Robert Morris University in 2015 with a degree in Software Engineering. I have worked at PNC Financial Services for 3 years prior to working as a freelance developer. My time at PNC included working on rotations through the Virtual Wallet dev team as a software engineer, a 3rd-tier support analyst, a business systems analyst and Application developer with the C&IB department. I have utilized skills in SQL and database management in report development. Currently, I am open to working for new clients as a full stack developer. My skills include project work with JAVA/android app development, Javascript, HTML5, CSS3, SQL, and various other technologies. Click here for my resume.

PNC Financial Services

Technology Development Program Associate

Graduate of the Technology Development program. Uitlized skills in Object Oriented Programming, JAVA, and XML while working on the Virtual Wallet Dev team. Learned and assisted in developing software components that are scalable, extensible, resilient, meet SLAs, and followed industry standards. Worked on 3rd-tier support utilizing the ServiceNow application.

PNC Financial Data Mart

Datamart Application Developer

Used SQL and database knowledge to independently complete 10+ customer focused OBIEE reports. Built 13 OBIEE reports to increase business credit response time and decrease auto advance loan time. Utilized skills in SQL, Database management, and UI/UX to create financial reports for customers. Worked with tools such as TOAD, OBIEE Admin Tool, Teradata Studio, Microsoft Excel, and OBIEE BI Publisher.

Freelance Developer

Full Stack Developer

Managed clients and time-sensitive projects for personal freelancing business. Developed Android mobile applications utilizing Java, UI design, and database management. Front End experience developing websites and mobile applications. Skills in JAVA, Javascipt, HTML5, CSS3, SQL, Node.js, RESTful APIs, ect...
